page.title: 17Tourism in Caerhun Parish
page.content: Many walkers pass through Rowen in the summer months, bound for the Youth Hostel high above the village en route to Bwlch-y-Ddeufaen and the surrounding hills. This is one of the approaches to Snowdonia via the Carneddau from Pen-y-Gaer. Touring motorists travel mainly through Llanbedr-y-Cennin although there are also two routes from Rowen, one of them a gated road, to Pen-y-Gaer and Bwlch-y-Ddeufaen. There are parking areas at the end of each road from where climbers and walkers can set out. Coach trips from Llandudno arrive here for evening outings and walks through the village calling for supper or refreshments at the village cafe or at the Ty Gwyn Inn. There are also many holiday homes in this area.
